name: github-business-docs-mcp
description: Manage business documents in GitHub with personal commit attribution
long_description: A minimal Model Context Protocol server for managing business documents in GitHub repositories. All commits show YOUR name, not a bot account. Provides 7 essential tools: create/update files, read files, list contents, delete files, search code, list commits, and get repository catalog.

github_client_id.title: GitHub App Client ID
github_client_id.description: Your GitHub OAuth App Client ID (starts with 'Iv')

github_client_secret.title: GitHub App Client Secret
github_client_secret.description: Your GitHub OAuth App Client Secret

default_docroot.title: Default Document Root
default_docroot.description: Default subfolder to scan for documents (e.g., 'docs'). Leave empty to scan entire repository.

tools.name: get_repository_catalog
tools.description: Get minimal catalog of repository documents. Respects docroot configuration to limit scope. Returns flat file list only (no tree structure).

tools.name: create_or_update_file
tools.description: Create or update a file in the GitHub repository

tools.name: get_file
tools.description: Get the contents of a file from the repository

tools.name: list_contents
tools.description: List the contents of a directory in the repository

tools.name: delete_file
tools.description: Delete a file from the repository

tools.name: search_code
tools.description: Search for code across the repository

tools.name: list_commits
tools.description: List commit history for the repository or a specific file
